perfcenter.simulator

Class DeviceSim

  • java.lang.Object
    • perfcenter.baseclass.QueuingResource
      • perfcenter.baseclass.Device
        • perfcenter.simulator.DeviceSim
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QueueServer

    public class DeviceSim
extends Device
implements QueueServer
    Contains simulation structures and simulation logic for Device.

      • processTaskEndEvent

        public void processTaskEndEvent(Request request,
                       int instanceId,
                       double currTime)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        If there is next hardware device, then request is offered to the device. else new event software task end is generated. When a task at device ends, then following are the five options. 
         if there is next device
                1. offer request to next device.
                return
 else (there is no next device)
                if device was part of task
                        if there is next virt res
                                2. offer request to next virt res
                                return
                        else (there is no next virt res)
                                3. new event software task end is generated
                                return
                else if device was part of soft res
                        if there is next level softres
                                4. offer request to it
                                return
                        else
                                5. new event virtual res task ends is generated
                                return
        Specified by:
        processTaskEndEvent in interface QueueServer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • dropRequest

        public void dropRequest(Request request,
               double currentTime)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        if the resource is a hardware resource like cpu then while discarding the request, this method: 1. takes care of the thread allocated to the request 2. takes care of contributions made to performance measures of current software server
        Specified by:
        dropRequest in interface QueueServer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
